title: Why we love dumplings
intro: Every country seems to have its own version of dumplings! Neil and Beth discuss this delicious food and teach you some useful vocabulary.
this_week_question: a) Wheat b) Potato or, c) Animal fat
Listen to the programme to hear the answer.

exclamation used to say that food tastes or smells very good
used to invite someone to start eating and encourage them to eat as much as they want
food that makes you feel happier because it tastes good to eat, or because it reminds you of home

Fillings can be anything from meat and fish to vegetables, tofu or cheese. And the dough is usually based on a starchy grain like wheat, rice, corn or potato. In fact, the English word, ‘dumpling’, comes from a 17th century adjective, dump, meaning ‘dough-like’.
